> - **[](https://ethfans.org/)** ## Truffle --- ### Node.js - node.js ### truffle - ` npm install -g truffle` ## --- - `truffle init` - truffle initdemo - `init` ![](images/block_chain/structure.png) - contractsSolidityMigrations.sol - migrations1_initial_migration.jsMigrations.sol - test - truffle.js - Truffle - (truffle) ``` Commands: init //Initialize new and empty Ethereum project compile //Compile contract source files migrate //Run migrations to deploy contracts deploy //(alias for migrate) build //Execute build pipeline (if configuration present) test //Run JavaScript and Solidity tests debug //Interactively debug any transaction on the blockchain (experimental) opcode //Print the compiled opcodes for a given contract console //Run a console with contract abstractions and commands available develop //Open a console with a local development blockchain create //Helper to create new contracts, migrations and tests install //Install a package from the Ethereum Package Registry publish //Publish a package to the Ethereum Package Registry networks //Show addresses for deployed contracts on each network watch //Watch filesystem for changes and rebuild the project automatically serve //Serve the build directory on localhost and watch for changes exec //Execute a JS module within this Truffle environment unbox //Download a Truffle Box, a pre-built Truffle project version //Show version number and exit ``` `truffle` ## --- - Ganache[github](https://github.com/trufflesuite/ganache-cli) - [](https://github.com/trufflesuite/ganache/releases)(linux XX.AppImage) - ganache-cli `npm install -g ganache-cli` - GanachetestRPC ## --- - Ganache754510100ETH IPIDtruffle - truffle.js ``` module.exports = { networks: { development: { host: 'localhost', port: '7545', network_id: '*' // Match any network id } } }; ``` ### #### - `./contracts`.sol - `truffle cmpile` --compile-all #### - Truffle `MyContract.sol`( ****) ``` contract MyContract { ... } // or library MyContract { ... } ``` - :`./build/contracts` Truffle ### - `truffle migrate` - `migrations` `truffle migrate` `--reset` ### - Ganache754510100ETH IPIDtruffletruffle.js ``` module.exports = { networks: { development: { host: "127.0.0.1", port: 8545, network_id: "*" // Match any network id } } }; ``` - [](http://truffleframework.com/docs/advanced/configuration) ## --- - `truffle unbox metacoin `, - metacointruffle.js**** ``` truffle compile truffle migrate truffle test ``` - : ![](/images/block_chain/metacion_test_result.png) - ganache AccountsETHgasBlocksGanache6Transactions6Logs

## DLL
---

- DLL`Dynamic Link Library`

>A DLL file, short for Dynamic Link Library, is a type of file that contains instructions that other programs can call upon to do certain things. This way, multiple programs can share the abilities programmed into a single file, and even do so simultaneously.

>Unlike executable programs, like those with the EXE file extension, DLL files can't be run directly but instead must be called upon by other code that is already running. However, DLLs are in the same format as EXEs and some may even use the .EXE file extension. While most Dynamic Link Libraries end in the file extension .DLL, others may use .OCX, .CPL, or .DRV.

hadoop sudo`sudo usermod -aG sudo hadoop ` - `sudo`sudo`cat /etc/group` - hadoop - [](https://blog.csdn.net/lymemoryzz/article/details/50627767) ### ssh - **hadoop** - `sudo apt-get install openssh-server ` - `sudo /etc/init.d/ssh start ` - `ps -e | grep ssh ` ![](/images/Hadoop/ssh_log.png) #### ssh - hadoop(.sshkey) - `ssh-keygen -t rsa -P ""` ![](/images/Hadoop/ssh_key.png) - Enter/home/{username}/.sshid_rsaid_rsa.pubauthorized_keysauthorized_keysssh - • ,JavaScript,HTML.JavaScript,.

  • JavaScript,,.onload.(DOM), . ,windowonload.

  • window.onload = insertDateTime;JavaScript,insertDateTime().

  •

//ensure a DOM-aware user agent
if(!document.getElementById) return;
if(!document.createTextNode) return;

//create a date-time object
var oNow = new Date()
//get the current date & time as a string
var sDateTime = oNow.toLocaleString();

//delete everything inside the target
while(oTarget.firstChild){
oTarget.removeChild(oTarget.firstChild);
}

//use the date-time string to create a new text node for the page
var oNewText = document.createTextNode(sDateTime);

//insert the new text into the span
oTarget.appendChild(oNewText);

sDateTimeDate.

- document,,.,appendChild().

> ## Java --- JetBrian[Intellij IDEA](https://www.jetbrains.com/idea/)eclipsejetBrianIntellij IDEA - Ultimate[Intellij IDEA Ultimate](https://fleschier.github.io/2018/05/jetbrains/) - intellij IDEA 1. systemsettingsreopen previous project 2. project structurelib(library)sdk/jdk() - ctrl + alt + s ## --- > javaC++ ### JAVAHelloworld - ``` public class HelloWorld { public static void main(String[] args) { System.out.println("Hello World"); // Hello World } } ``` ### Java - JavaHellohello - MyFirstJavaClass - Java.java - Java `public static void main(String[] args)` - javaC++`*` - **JavaC++Java00truefalse** ### Java - | | | | -------- |--------- | | boolean | false | | char | '/uoooo'(null) | | byte | (byte)0 | | short | (short)0 | | int | 0 | | long | 0L | | float | 0.0f | | double | 0.0d | ### Java - Java - : default, public , protected, private - : final, abstract, strictfp ### Java - ,bug ``` class ENUM_class{ enum Test{Small, Medium, Large} Test size; } public class ENUM_class_Test{ public static void main(String[] args){ ENUM_class tst = new ENUM_class(); tst.size = ENUM_class.Test.Small; } } ``` ### Java - ? 1 : 2 - true12 - ``` int x =1,y =2; xy"); ``` - ### Java - JavaC++ ## Java >JavaC++Python --- ### ``` import java.io.* //java.io ... ... InputStreamReader in = new InputStreamReader(System.in); BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(in); System.out.print("Please enter a num:"); String s = br.readLine(); //s float num; num = Float.parseFloat(s); //float System.out.println(); ... ``` ### #### Scannner - ``` import java.util.* ... float score; Scanner sn = new Scanner(System.in); System.out.println("Please enter a num:"); score = sn.nextFloat(); System.out.println(); ``` - *scan* ``` Scanner scan = new Scanner(System.in) int num = scan.nextInt(); // Double d = scan.nextDouble(); // String s = scan.nextline(); // ``` - Scanner - nextInt()\rnextLine() - nextInt()\rnextLine()\r\rnextLine() - nextline()nextline() Intnextline()parseInt()Int ### - import java.io.IOException; // #### ``` import java.io.IOException class test{ public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException{ char c = (char) System.in.read(); } } ``` **intASCII** #### byte ``` import java.io.IOException; class test { public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException{ byte[] input = new byte[5]; //byte System.in.read(input); //byte System.out.println(input[1]); //intASCII } } ``` ### ``` import javax.swing.* //javax,swing ... String str; float score; str = JOptionPane.showInputDialog("please enter a num:"); score = Float.parseFloat(str); ... ``` ## --- - `System.out.println();` - `System.out.printf();` // ``` //"%""%" System.out.printf("%f",d);//"f" System.out.printf("%9.2f",d);//"9.2"92 System.out.printf("%+9.2f",d);//"+" System.out.printf("%-9.4f",d);//"-" System.out.printf("%+-9.3f",d);//"+-" System.out.printf("%d",i);//"d" System.out.printf("%o",i);//"o" System.out.printf("%x",i);//"d" System.out.printf("%#x",i);//"d" System.out.printf("%s",s);//"d" System.out.printf("%f%d%s",d,i,s); // System.out.printf("%2$s%1$d%1$#x",i,s); //"X$" ``` ### ``` JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(....) // ``` ## --- ### - [] [] - Java****`int a[10];`** [] = new []** - C++`int a[] = {1,6,8};` `int a = new int[3]; a[0]=1,a[1]=6,a[2]=8;` - - `a.length` aa**.lengtha.length()length** ### #### Math.random() - `int num =(int)(Math.random() * 11);` [0,1) #### java.util.Random - ``` import Java.util.Random; Random rand = new Random([]); int randomNum = rand.nextInt() //Randomboolean, byte, int, long, float, double int randomNUM2 = rand.nextInt(100); //[0,100) ... ``` ### String - StringStringjavaString - ``` String a = "avc"; a = "bfd"; //stringastringstring ```

> - **** ## --- ### - `create database XXX` - ``` create database School on( name = 'School_data', filename = 'c:\data\School_data.mdf', size = 5mb, filegrowth = 1mb -- ) ``` - `create table XXX` - ``` create table student( Sno char(6) primary key, Sname varchar(8), Ssex char(2), Sage smallint, Sdept varchar(15) ) ``` - ``` create table student( Sno char(6) primary key, -- Sname varchar(8) not null constraint ck_1 unique, -- Ssex char(2) not null constraint ck_2 check(Ssex in('','')), Sage smallint constraint ck_3 check(sage>16), Sdept varchar(15) default 'JSJ' -- ) create table course( Cno char(6) primary key, Cname varchar(20), Cpno char(4), Ccredit tinyint ) create table SC( Sno char(6) not null, -- Cno char(6) not null, Grade decimal(12,1) constraint ck_6 check(Grade <= 100 and Grade >=0) constraint fk_1 foreign key (Sno) references student(sno) ) alter table SC add constraint PK_SC primary key(Sno,Cno) ``` checkconstraint - foreign key ``` create table sc( Sno char(6), Cno char(4), Grade decimal(12,2), primary key(Sno,Cno), foreign key(Sno) references student(Sno), foreign key(Cno) references course(Cno) ) ``` ### ``` create index Ix_student_sname on student(Sname) create index Ix_student_sdept on student(Sdept) create index Ix_sc_cno on SC(Cno) create index Ix_course_cname on Course(Cname) sp_help student -- drop index student.ix_student_sname -- ``` ### > ``` insert into student values('5001','','','20','SX') insert into student values('5002','','','21','JSJ') insert into student values('5001','','','20','SX') ``` ### ``` --(student sc_name) insert into sc_name (Sno,Sname,Ssex) select Sno,Sname,Ssex from student where Sdept = 'SX' ``` ## --- ### ``` create table student( Sno char(6), Sname varchar(8), Ssex char(2), Sage smallint, Sdept varchar(15) ) alter table student add address varchar(60) -- alter table student add inDate datetime --datetime alter table student alter column adress varchar(50) alter table student drop column inDate ``` ### ``` alter table student add constraint cs_1 check(Ssex in ('','')) alter table student add constraint cs_2 check(Sage >16) alter table Course add constraint cs_3 check(Ccredit in (0,1,2,3,4,5)) alter table Course add constraint cs_4 check(Cno != Cpno) ``` - `alter table student drop constraint cs_1` ### - update `update student set Sno = 4018 where Sno = 4003` ## --- - `sp_help ` - `sp_helpdb ` ## --- ### - `select [*] from ` ### () ``` select Sno,Sname,Sage from student where Sage >= 19 and Sage <= 21 and Ssex = '' order by Sage desc -- descasc ``` ``` select Sno,Ssex from student where Sname like '_%' --'_'%, ``` ``` select Sno,Cno from SC where Grade is null -- '= null' ``` ``` select Sno,Cno,cast((Grade/10) as int)from SC -- cast(a as int) ``` ``` select distinct Sdept from student -- distinct ``` ### ``` select count(*) as number from student where Sname like '%%' -- ``` ``` select Cno,sum(Grade) as total_grade,avg(Grade) as avg_grade,max(Grade) as max_grade,min(Grade) as min_grade from SC group by Cno order by avg_grade desc -- sum() ``` ``` select Cno from SC where Grade >= 85 group by Cno having count(Sno)>10 -- where group grouphaving ``` ``` select Sno from SC where Grade <60 group by Sno having count(Cno) > 2 ``` ### ``` select distinct Cno from student,SC where student.Sno = SC.Sno and Sdept = 'JSJ' -- ``` ``` -- select Sname from student,SC where student.Sno = SC.Sno and Cno = 1002 XXXXXX select Sname from student join SC on student.Sno = Sc.Sno where Cno = 1002 -- JOIN..ON.. XXXXXX select Sname from student where Sno in( -- select Sno from SC where Cno = 1002 ) ``` ``` select student.Sno, Grade from student,course,SC where student.Sno = SC.Sno and course.Cno = SC.Cno and Cname = '' and Grade <60 --. ``` ``` -- select student.Sname from student,SC where student.Sno = SC.Sno and Grade >= 80 and Cno = 1004 XXXXXX select Sname from student where Sno in( -- select Sno from SC where Grade > 80 and Cno in( select Cno from course where Cname = '' ) ) ``` ### ### ``` -- select top 1 Sno,avg(Grade) as avg_grade from SC group by Sno order by avg(Grade) desc XXXXXX select Sno,avg(Grade) as avg_grade from SC group by Sno having avg(Grade) >= all(select avg(Grade) from SC group by Sno) ``` ## --- - `drop table XXX` - `delete from XXX` - `drop database XXX` - `drop constraint XXX` ## --- ### ``` -- create procedure usp_makedata as declare @nCnt int, @sNo char(6), @sname varchar(8) set @nCnt = 12000 --counter while @nCnt <999999 begin set @nCnt = @nCnt +1 set @sNo = convert(varchar(6),@nCnt) set @sName = '' +@sno insert into student (sno,sname,ssex,sage) values (@sno,@sname,'',20) end return exec usp_makedata -- ``` ### ``` -- create procedure usp_test as declare @nCount int ,@data int set @nCount=0 while @nCount <100 begin select @data = count(*) from student where sname <'3800' or sname >'8800' set @nCount =@nCount + 1 end exec usp_test -- ``` ### ``` drop procedure usp_makedata drop procedure usp_test ``` ## E-R --- - (Entity) - (Attribute) - (Relationship)(1 : 11 : nm : n) () - ![](/images/SQL/E-R graphe.png) - ![](/images/SQL/TIM20180503210911.jpg) () ### E-R - **** - - **1** **** 1()1()() **** - **** `()` - - [](https://blog.csdn.net/sunzhenhua0608/article/details/8822871) - [](https://blog.csdn.net/zxq1138634642/article/details/9121363)

Post.content:
• ssrssubuntu18,ssssr()

ss

  •

sudo apt-get install python-pip
sudo pip install shadowsocks

mkdir ~/.shadowsocks
cd .shadowsocks
touch ss.json
//
{
server:1.1.1.1,
server_port:8388,
local_address: 127.0.0.1,
local_port:1080,
password:your passwd,
timeout:300,
method:aes-256-cfb
}

vim /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/shadowsocks/crypto/openssl.py
//52shadowsocks2.8.2cleanup
//
52libcrypto.EVP_CIPHER_CTX_cleanup.argtypes = (c_void_p,)
libcrypto.EVP_CIPHER_CTX_reset.argtypes = (c_void_p,)
//
cleanup2111libcrypto.EVP_CIPHER_CTX_cleanup(self._ctx)
libcrypto.EVP_CIPHER_CTX_reset(self._ctx)
//

raw.githubusercontent.com
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/gfwlist/gfwlist/master/gfwlist.txt

,SwitchyOmega(chorme),.

![](/images/ssr/auto_switch_01.png)

![](/images/ssr/auto_switch_02.png)

![](/images/ssr/example.png)

- ,

- chormepcd,,,ssr

- 

<br>

> > **[stackoverflow.com](https://stackoverflow.com/)** > API:[](http://spark.apachecn.org/) ## DataSet DataFrame --- - DatasetDatasetDataFrame - DataSetRDDDataSetRDDDataSetAPIRDD - DatasetDataFrameDataFrameDatasetSparkDatasetRDDAPI ### DataFrame ``` import org.apache.spark.sql.SparkSession ... val sparkses = SparkSession .builder() .getOrCreate() // val df = sparkses.read.csv("...filename.csv") //read df.show() // ``` ### DataSet - case class - ``` val sparkses = SparkSession .builder() .getOrCreate() case class KeyValue(key: Int, value: String) import sparkses.implicit._ // val df = Seq((1,"asdf"),(2,"34234")).toDF("key", "value") val ds = df.as[KeyValue] // org.apache.spark.sql.Dataset[KeyValue] = [key: int, value: string] ``` - case class22 - - ``` val tupDs = df.as[(Int,String)] // org.apache.spark.sql.Dataset[(Int, String)] = [_1: int, _2: string] ```

spark [](https://www.cnblogs.com/earendil/p/5564492.html) - sparkconflog4j.properties.template log4j.properties, log4j.rootCategory = INFO, consoleINFOWARN - spark`/usr/local/Apache/``echo $SPARK_HOME`spark - sparkPATH(`/etc/profile`)`spark-shell`scala ![](/images/spark/spark-shell.png) - [sbt](https://www.scala-sbt.org/download.html) ## --- - sparkPythonJavascalaR**scala** - intellij IDEAmaven ### - ctrl + Q intellij - Maven mavenjarbuildjar - Mavensparkpom ## mavenscala - [spark](https://blog.csdn.net/u012373815/article/details/53266301) - pom ## spark wordcount --- > - ``` text_file = sc.textFile("hdfs://...") //hdfs counts = text_file.flatMap(lambda line: line.split(" ")) \ .map(lambda word: (word, 1)) \ .reduceByKey(lambda a, b: a + b) counts.saveAsTextFile("hdfs://...") ``` - (spark-shell) (scala) ``` val counts = sc.textFile("hdfs://...(hdfs)").flatMap(_.split(" ")).map(x => (x,1)).reduceByKey(_ + _).collect().foreach(println) // ``` - .collect()actionactionspark**** ## jar --- ### `spark-submit` - spark-submit,Sparkbin #### - spark ``` ./bin/spark-submit \ --class \ --master \ --deploy-mode \ --conf = \ ... # other options \ [application-arguments] ``` #### (.sh) ``` input=/data/ output=/AR_res/ hdfs dfs -rm -r $output hdfs dfs -rm -r /user_res spark-submit \ -v \ --name "ARsMiner" \ --class "com.hazzacheng.AR.Main" \ --executor-cores 4 \ --executor-memory 10G \ --driver-memory 20G \ AR.jar \ $input \ $output \ 2>&1 | tee log/AR_log rm -rf AR_res/ hdfs dfs -get $output cat /root$output/part* > /root/res #sort /root$output/part* > /root/res ``` #### - --class,mainorg.apache.spark.examples.SparkPi - --masterspark//23.195.26.1877077 - --deploy-modeclusterclientclient - --confKey = valueSparkkey = value - application-jarjarURLhdfs//file// - application-argumentsmain - EC2clientclientspark-submitREPLSpark shell - cluster #### ``` # Run application locally on 8 cores ./bin/spark-submit \ --class org.apache.spark.examples.SparkPi \ --master local[8] \ /path/to/examples.jar \ 100 ``` ``` # Run on a Spark standalone cluster in client deploy mode ./bin/spark-submit \ --class org.apache.spark.examples.SparkPi \ --master spark://207.184.161.138:7077 \ --executor-memory 20G \ --total-executor-cores 100 \ /path/to/examples.jar \ 1000 ``` ``` # Run on a Spark standalone cluster in cluster deploy mode with supervise ./bin/spark-submit \ --class org.apache.spark.examples.SparkPi \ --master spark://207.184.161.138:7077 \ --deploy-mode cluster \ --supervise \ --executor-memory 20G \ --total-executor-cores 100 \ /path/to/examples.jar \ 1000 ``` ``` # Run on a YARN cluster export HADOOP_CONF_DIR=XXX ./bin/spark-submit \ --class org.apache.spark.examples.SparkPi \ --master yarn \ --deploy-mode cluster \ # can be client for client mode --executor-memory 20G \ --num-executors 50 \ /path/to/examples.jar \ 1000 ``` ``` # Run a Python application on a Spark standalone cluster ./bin/spark-submit \ --master spark://207.184.161.138:7077 \ examples/src/main/python/pi.py \ 1000 ``` ``` # Run on a Mesos cluster in cluster deploy mode with supervise ./bin/spark-submit \ --class org.apache.spark.examples.SparkPi \ --master mesos://207.184.161.138:7077 \ --deploy-mode cluster \ --supervise \ --executor-memory 20G \ --total-executor-cores 100 \ http://path/to/examples.jar \ 1000 ``` ## spark - Spark SQL SparkSession . SparkSession, SparkSession.builder() ``` import org.apache.spark.sql.SparkSession val sparkses = SparkSession .builder() // [.appName("Spark SQL basic example") ] [.config("spark.some.config.option", "some-value")] [.master("local")] .getOrCreate() // // For implicit conversions like converting RDDs to DataFrames // import sparkses.implicits._ ``` > DatasetRDDAPIRDDAPI - spark sparkcontext ``` import org.apache.spark.{SparkConf, SparkContext} ... val conf = new SparkConf()[.set(...)...] val sc = new SparkContext(conf) ``` ## --- > spark > **[stackoverflow.com](https://stackoverflow.com/)** - **[](http://spark.apachecn.org/)** ### FP-Growth: ``` Items in a transaction must be unique but got WrappedArrayMaven ``` fpg`RDD(Array[String])`Arraydistinct ### spark-shellInsufficient space for shared memory file - - `df` ![](/images/spark/.png) `/` 100%spark-shell ## --- - spark - List `distinct` - item::list item - Array `flatMap`,`list.(?)` - scala`.sortBy()`

- extention - 1. ``` wget -nv -O Release.key \ https://build.opensuse.org/projects/home:manuelschneid3r/public_key sudo apt-key add - < Release.key sudo apt-get update ``` 2. ``` sudo sh -c "echo 'deb http://download.opensuse.org/repositories/home:/manuelschneid3r/xUbuntu_18.04/ /' > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/home:manuelschneid3r.list" sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install albert ``` - [](https://albertlauncher.github.io/docs/installing/) ## --- - home `.themes` `.icons` - [mac](https://imcn.me/html/y2017/29004.html) ## gnome extensions recommend --- ### Ubuntu,. - Desktop Scroller: (), - > ## --- ### - `ls -l` `ll``ls -a` - `vim``:q!` - ubuntu `mv name1 name2` - `cp filename filepath` // - `cp -r ` // - hdfs `hdfs dfs -get /.../filename storepath` - `which python`python - `sudo apt-get remove + ` apt - `chmod [-][<>+/-/=<>] /` // - `chown [-R] username filename/directoryname` // - `touch ` - PATH `echo $PATH` - `rm -rf` - `dpkg -i filename.deb` // .deb ### grep - Linux grep - `grep [option] pattern file` - `grep [-abcEFGhHilLnqrsvVwxy][-A<>][-B<>][-C<>][-d<>][-e<>][-f<>][--help][][...]` - ****`cat AR_log | grep "====" `AR_log"====" - file test ``` grep test *file ``` ### apt - `apt-cache search package` - `apt-cache show package` - `sudo apt-get install package` - `sudo apt-get install package - - reinstall` - `sudo apt-get -f install` "-f = fix-missing" - `sudo apt autoremove` **** - `sudo apt-get update` - `sudo apt-get upgrade` **** - `apt-cache depends package` - `apt-cache rdepends package` - `sudo apt-get build-dep package` - `sudo apt-get clean && sudo apt-get autoclean` - `sudo apt-get check` ### scp - `scp [] file_source file_target ` - : `scp /home/fleshier/My_Programes/Programes/AssociationRuleDiscovery/target/AR.jar root@192.168.1.201:/root` root192.168.1.201 `/root` - - `-r` `scp root@192.168.1.201:/root/runAR.sh /home/fleschier/cloud\ computing/ ` - `@IP:` - scp -P ``` #scp 4588 scp -P 4588 remote@www.runoob.com:/usr/local/sin.sh /home/administrator ``` ### curl - curlhttpftp - curl`sudo apt-get install curl` - get`curl http://www.baidu.com` HTMLURL - [curl](http://www.cnblogs.com/linjiqin/p/5484910.html) ### gem - `gem install appname` - Gem Ruby - gem `/[Ruby root]/lib/ruby/gems/[ver]/` `Cachedocgemsspecifications` 4`cache` gem `gems` gem - gem `gem install [gemname]`

Post.title: VScodeAnacodatensorflow
Post._content:
## 

- tensorflow.**AnacodaTensorflow,Tensorflow,.**

---
- **:pylint,tensorflow,tensorflow.**

## 
---

- tensorflow,AnacodaVScode.

- ,VScode pythonpylint,pylinttensorflow,import.

## StackOverflow
---

- [](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/49601292/python-not-finding-tensorflow-module-under-anaconda)

- :

> are you using Visual Studio Code (VSC) or just pylint in general? I found out the reason why this is happening.
For VSC, the python extension, use pylint for intellisense of python. Pylint seems to have a bug with the sub-module. For me, the error only shows in VSC and not in prompt.
I solved this problem by doing the following steps:
Click "Code" -> Click "Preferences" -> Click "Settings"
Now in the settings, you have a search bar on top, search:
python.linting.pylintEnable and set it to false
Now there is alternative for linting, I am using the pep8 as a example here since it come with the anaconda, search this
python.linting.pep8Enabled and set it to true
Now pylint is not the default linter anymore, we are now using the pep8. Just to make sure, quit VSC and reopen it. there should not be any error anymore.
I am fairly sure this is a problem with pylint, instead of the TF you installed. By default, the Microsoft python extension in the VSC is using pylint as the linting tool. By changing it to pep8 or other we can avoid the error.
,pylinttensorflow.**pylint,pep8**

- : VScode`python.linting`,`pylint.Enabling`,`pep8.Enabling`.,.

## 
---

- pep8,,: .

- ,"","",Error,.

- ,(,).

- ,,,(~)

- [()](https://qiita.com/zaki-yama/items/d05adce9d23d67144fbf)

- :
1. .configpep8:
```
vim ~ .config/pep8
```

2. :
```
[pep8]
ignore = E226,E302,E41,E265,E231,E303
max-line-length = 200
```
,`ignore`,,,.

3. ,VScode.

         println
      }
   }
}
```

Post.title: Ubuntu18 VsCodeC++()
Post._content:
> ,C++,.

## 
---

- VsCodeg++

## C++
---

- C++,:
```
C/C++
C/C++ Intellisense
```

## 
---

### C++

#### :C/C++ Compile Run(,)

- ,~

- (single file),

- C++F6

- :
>Requirements
If you are on linux you must install gcc
If you are on window you must install mingw
How to use
Make sure you have .c or .cpp file open and press "F6", this will compile the file. If you want to register gcc/g++ path manually you can set it under settings. You can also set to save file before compiling.

#### :task.jsonlaunch.json

- C++,Debug,,,:
```
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": "(gdb) Launch",
            "type": "cppdbg",
            "request": "launch",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/${fileBasenameNoExtension}.o",
            "args": [],
            "stopAtEntry": false,
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "environment": [],
            "externalConsole": true,
            "preLaunchTask": "build",  
            "MIMode": "gdb",
            "setupCommands": [
                {
                    "description": "Enable pretty-printing for gdb",
                    "text": "-enable-pretty-printing",
                    "ignoreFailures": true
                }
            ]
        }
    ]
}
```

- C++,`Ctrl + Shift + B` build >> other >> tasks.json:
```
{  
    "version": "0.1.0",  
    "showOutput": "always",  
    "tasks": [
        {
            "taskName": "build",
            "command": "g++",
            "isShellCommand": true,
            "showOutput": "always",
            "args": [
                "-g",
                "${file}",
                "-o",
                "${workspaceRoot}/${fileBasenameNoExtension}.o"
            ],
            "problemMatcher": [
                "$g++"
            ]
        }
    ]  
}
```

### 

- `Ctrl + Shift + B` build

- debug

> ~
